p: Airway changes, including bronchial wall thickening and centrilobular micronodules and with tree-in-bud, remain infrequent. The most observed sign is an air bronchogram ( Figure 10), identified between ground-glass opacities or consolidations. Peribronchial inflammatory changes, represented by parietal or peribronchovascular interstitial thickening, can retract the walls with consequent distortion and ectasia ( 20) ( Figure 10).
